example_sentences.jap_sentence: おもしろくない（＝退屈な）本
英語がおもしろくなくなる（＝興味を失う）

example_sentences.eng_trans: The story was very interesting to me./I was greatly amused at [by] the story.
example_sentences.jap_sentence: その話は私にはとてもおもしろかった
その本は読んでみるとおもしろかった[おもしろくなかった]

example_sentences.eng_trans: I read the story with great interest.
example_sentences.jap_sentence: その話を大変おもしろく読んだ

example_sentences.eng_trans: He's a very funny fellow./He is great [good] fun.
example_sentences.jap_sentence: あの男はとてもおもしろいやつだ

example_sentences.eng_trans: Playing tag is a lot of fun [is really enjoyable].
example_sentences.jap_sentence: 鬼ごっこはとてもおもしろい

example_sentences.eng_trans: We had lots of fun [had a very good time, enjoyed ourselves very much] at the party.
example_sentences.jap_sentence: パーティーはとてもおもしろかった

example_sentences.eng_trans: (I found) the wrestling match was really exciting./I really enjoyed the wrestling match.
example_sentences.jap_sentence: そのレスリングの試合は実におもしろかった

example_sentences.eng_trans: London is a really exciting [interesting] place.
example_sentences.jap_sentence: ロンドンはとてもおもしろいところだ
あれはおもしろいですか（＝心に訴えますか）

example_sentences.eng_trans: His sissy attitude gets on my nerves.
example_sentences.jap_sentence: 彼のにやけた態度がおもしろくない（＝気にさわる）

example_sentences.eng_trans: “Would you like to go to the ballet next Saturday?”“Oh, that sounds interesting [like fun].”
example_sentences.jap_sentence: 「来週の土曜日バレエを見に行かないかい」 「まあ,おもしろそうね」

example_sentences.eng_trans: “Taro's still very keen on golf.”“I can't understand what he sees in it.”
example_sentences.jap_sentence: 「太郎はあいかわらずゴルフに夢中になってるよ」 「あんなものどこがおもしろいのか分からないよ」

example_sentences.eng_trans: “Please try to come. It won't be much of a party without you.”“It's nice of you to say that. I'll do my best.”
example_sentences.jap_sentence: 「なんとかしていらしてくださいね。あなたがいないとあまりおもしろいパーティーにならないから」 「そう言ってくれてありがとう。精々行くようにするよ」
